text: or was a old province of Japan in the area of Mie Prefecture. ==History== In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. The maps of Japan and Izu Province were reformed in the 1870s. ==Shrines and Temples== Izawanomiya jinja and Izawa jinja were the chief Shinto shrines (ichinomiya) of H≈çki."Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 1 ; retrieved 2012-1-20. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan ==References== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Former provinces of Japan Category:Mie Prefecture
